stanza.line: Lord of my love to whom in (a)vassalage(/a)
Thy merit hath my duty strongly (b)knit(/b)
To thee I send this written (a)embassage(/a)
To witness duty not to show my (b)wit(/b)
Duty so great which wit so poor as (c)mine(/c)
May make seem bare in wanting words to show (d)it(/d)
But that I hope some good conceit of (c)thine(/c)
In thy soul's thought (all naked) will bestow (d)it(/d)
Till whatsoever star that guides my (e)moving(/e)
Points on me graciously with fair (f)aspect(/f)
And puts apparel on my tattered (e)loving(/e)
To show me worthy of thy sweet (f)respect(/f)
Then may I dare to boast how I do love (g)thee(/g)
Till then not show my head where thou mayst prove (g)me(/g)
